description: Sunlit piazzas, candlelit canals, and slow kisses — a soundtrack for Italian romance.

items.name: Venice – A Gondola Spell You Can’t Resist!
Florence – Intoxicating Beauty & Fine Wine
items.description: Best known for its Renaissance art and architecture, Florence is a part of the top honeymoon destinations in Europe for its mesmerizing cityscape. Besides breathtaking beauty, Florence – the capital of the Tuscany region is home to the world-famous Tuscanian vineyards, making it among the best places in Italy for honeymoon. Come here to be intoxicated with Italy's fine wine, spellbinding beauty, and the romance in the air. It is one of the magnificent Italian honeymoon destinations.

items.name: Cilento – A Secret Hideout For Lovebirds
Naples – Enjoy The Views And Pizzas
items.description: If your honeymoon in Italy doesn't include a visit to Naples, trust us, you will regret it. It has everything to sweep you both off your feet – a stunning volcano view, culinary brilliance, medieval structures, and a coastline that'll make your heart skip a beat. From graffiti to frescoes, you'll find music in everything when you're in this Italian city. There are a lot of things to do in Naples on your honeymoon. It is one of the best romantic places to visit in Italy.

items.name: Capri Islands – A Dazzling Fairyland
items.description: Located on the Bay of Naples, Capri Islands is nature's mystique playing with uptown glamour. Yes! From dramatic craggy landscapes to designer showrooms, Capri is the place that will never bore you. This is among the most romantic places in Italy, mainly because of Blue Grotto, a dark cavern where the sea glows due to the sunlight. For an Italy beach honeymoon, visit this place.

items.name: Rome – Take A Stroll Amidst The Roman History
items.description: Rome puts the ‘rom' in romance, and thus a list of the best honeymoon cities in Italy seems incomplete without it. The capital of Italy is a mesh of glitz, glamour, and art forms that dig deep into the heart. The Eternal City, Rome displays the finest of Italian architecture; so fine you'll lose your heart in its intricate details.

items.name: Lake Como – A Retreat For The Poets
items.description: Among little-known tourist destinations in Italy, this is the place to be for both of you! On the foothills of the Italian Alps, Lake Como sits quietly to mesmerize newlyweds who plan a honeymoon here. One of the most romantic places in Italy, the glacial lake looks like an inverted ‘Y', and is one of Europe's deepest lakes. Besides nature's grandeur, you'll be captivated by the Renaissance architecture of the region.

items.name: Amalfi – A Pristine Honeymoon Haven
items.description: Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Amalfi Coast in Amalfi has its charm elevated with dramatic cliffs that kiss the blue sea. Going beyond the sea, you'll find woods flourishing. Watching the sunset in this town while savouring the delightful Italian cuisine in a quaint cafe is an unbeatable idea for a super romantic date on your honeymoon in Italy. It is undoubtedly one of the best honeymoon destinations in Italy.

items.name: Verona – Romeo And Juliet’s Paradise
items.description: Verona's popularity stems from being the setting for Shakespeare's timeless love saga, Romeo and Juliet. If you are a literature lover, Verona will probably be at the top of this list of the best honeymoon cities in Italy. Hold your lover's hand and head to Verona's Arena to witness opera performances that are regarded among the most incredible in the world.

items.name: Monterosso Al Mare – Discover The Last Village
items.description: A small town that leaves massive traces of its beauty on your heart, Monterosso al Mare is the most quaint stop among the best honeymoon destinations in Italy. It is the last village in the Cinque Terre region of Italy. With your partner, go exploring both the old and the new town and move around admiring the many lemon trees, attractions like the castle and a church, and of course the azure shoreline.

items.name: Sicily – For A Memorable Honeymoon
items.description: Make your honeymoon a memorable one by heading to Sicily with your beloved. From marvellous castles to stunning islands, this region in Italy has everything which will make your honeymoon terrific for sure. This region is praised by many poets and is located in the heart of the Mediterranean. Go click some Instagrammable pictures on your honeymoon in Sicily, which is counted among the most popular honeymoon destinations in Italy.

items.name: Umbria – Green Heart Of Italy
items.description: Umbria is tagged as the green heart of Italy and is one of the most serene honeymoon cities in Italy. This panoramic region is sitting in the heart of Rome and Tuscany. It is the world's largest and most beautiful garden in the world that never fails to impress. The lack of crowds, unexplored corners, diverse landscapes, and untouched beauty make this destination one of its kind. The incredible architecture of this spot is truly cherishable.

items.name: Piedmont Region – Land Of Wines
items.description: One of the largest mountainous regions of the northwest corner of Italy, the Piedmont Region has found itself in the list of all the best honeymoon spots in Italy. This mountain range is surrounded by the Alps on all three sides and is famed for the Barolo and Barbera wines and white chocolate. Once the capital of the Duchy of Savoy, this countryside has its floors covered in magnificent castles, elegant palaces, and vast velvety vineyards. The Baroque architecture of these structures in this region leaves every traveller and spectator in awe.

items.name: Positano – Fairytale Land
items.description: One of the most picturesque towns that look right out of a fairytale, Positano is one of the top honeymoon destinations in Italy that takes away the breath of travellers. The cobbled streets of this destination are lined with houses that have colours so bright that they make one's jaws drop to the ground. The beauty, serenity, and magic of this destination are unmatchable, which makes it a perfect Italy honeymoon. From local art galleries to churches, this artistic town is a must-visit for every couple.

items.name: Bosa
items.description: Looking for a unique honeymoon destination in Italy that is less mainstream than Rome or Venice? Consider Bosa, located on the island of Sardinia. Bosa is known for its colourful hillside town overlooking the sea, medieval castle, churches, museums, and a plethora of beautiful restaurants and shops. The lack of major highways in Sardinia gives the charming town of Bosa and the rest of the island a rustic and exclusive feel. You can explore the stunning coastline through smaller, provincial roads, making for an exciting adventure. Start your day in Bosa with a typical Italian breakfast of espresso and rusks with tomatoes and olive oil, before heading out for the day. If you are an avid hiker, there are numerous nearby trails to discover. Alternatively, you can spend the day sailing on a catamaran and exploring the nearby Maddalena Archipelago.
